csw.services.cs.core

Interface ConfigManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigServiceClient, ConfigServiceHttpClient, GitConfigManager, SvnConfigManager

    public interface ConfigManager
    Defines an interface for storing and retrieving configuration information

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns true if the given path exists and is being managed

    • Method Detail

      • name

        java.lang.String name()
        The name of this instance
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • create

        scala.concurrent.Future<ConfigId> create(java.io.File path,
                                         ConfigData configData,
                                         boolean oversize,
                                         java.lang.String comment)
        Creates a file with the given path and data and optional comment. An IOException is thrown if the file already exists.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        configData - used to read the contents of the file
        oversize - true if the file is large and requires special handling (external storage)
        comment - an optional comment to associate with this file
        Returns:
        a unique id that can be used to refer to the file

      • update

        scala.concurrent.Future<ConfigId> update(java.io.File path,
                                         ConfigData configData,
                                         java.lang.String comment)
        Updates the config file with the given path and data and optional comment. An FileNotFoundException is thrown if the file does not exists.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        configData - used to read the contents of the file
        comment - an optional comment to associate with this file
        Returns:
        a unique id that can be used to refer to the file

      • createOrUpdate

        scala.concurrent.Future<ConfigId> createOrUpdate(java.io.File path,
                                                 ConfigData configData,
                                                 boolean oversize,
                                                 java.lang.String comment)
        Creates the file with the given path, or updates it, if it already exists.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        configData - used to read the contents of the file
        oversize - true if the file is large and requires special handling (external storage)
        comment - an optional comment to associate with this file
        Returns:
        a unique id that can be used to refer to the file

      • get

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.Option<ConfigData>> get(java.io.File path,
                                                      scala.Option<ConfigId> id)
        Gets and returns the file stored under the given path.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        id - an optional id used to specify a specific version to fetch (by default the latest version is returned)
        Returns:
        a future object that can be used to access the file's data, if found

      • get

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.Option<ConfigData>> get(java.io.File path,
                                                      java.util.Date date,
                                                      scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext ec)
        Gets the file as it existed on the given date. If date is before the file was created, the initial version is returned. If date is after the last change, the most recent version is returned. If the path does not exist in the repo, Future[None] is returned.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        date - the target date
        ec - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        a future object that can be used to access the file's data, if found

      • exists

        scala.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object> exists(java.io.File path)
        Returns true if the given path exists and is being managed

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        Returns:
        true the file exists

      • delete

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> delete(java.io.File path,
                                                        java.lang.String comment)
        Deletes the given config file (older versions will still be available)

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        comment - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • list

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.collection.immutable.List<ConfigFileInfo>> list()
        Returns a list containing all of the known config files

        Returns:
        a list containing one ConfigFileInfo object for each known config file

      • history

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.collection.immutable.List<ConfigFileHistory>> history(java.io.File path,
                                                                                    int maxResults)
        Returns a list of all known versions of a given path

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        maxResults - the maximum number of history results to return (default: unlimited)
        Returns:
        a list containing one ConfigFileHistory object for each version of path

      • setDefault

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> setDefault(java.io.File path,
                                                            scala.Option<ConfigId> id)
        Sets the "default version" of the file with the given path. If this method is not called, the default version will always be the latest version. After calling this method, the version with the given Id will be the default.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        id - an optional id used to specify a specific version (by default the id of the latest version is used)
        Returns:
        a future result

      • resetDefault

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> resetDefault(java.io.File path)
        Resets the "default version" of the file with the given path to be always the latest version.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        Returns:
        a future result

      • getDefault

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.Option<ConfigData>> getDefault(java.io.File path)
        Gets and returns the default version of the file stored under the given path. If no default was set, this returns the latest version.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path relative to the repository root
        Returns:
        a future object that can be used to access the file's data, if found
